rComments: Amazing professor!  He is incredibly knowledgable about his field and that comes across in his lectures.  I honestly worked harder in this class than any other, but it really was one of the best classes I have ever had.  Shoutout to Brien O'Connell as an amazing TA too.

Very good lectures that highlighted important information, complementing the reading. Answered questions clearly. I loved how excited he got sometimes during lecture, so cute. He is clearly one of the most beloved history professors at UCSC, it's a shame for incoming students who won't get a chance to take his classes as he is retiring.

Dope Scottish accent, keeps the lectures fresh. He's randomly funny at times, talking about his single malt whiskey and such. But yeah, he knows what hes talking about, and he does a pretty good job tying all of the facts and motives together. I'd recommend the class if you're a history major, there is a lot of reading

Sharp mind, great humor, @ especially great for the "Is British History Possible?" seminar.  I also recommend his courses on England and the Dutch Republic.  If you want to learn how to think/write like a historian, take him.  His training has served me well in graduate school.  One of the greatest.
Knows what he is talking about, but each lecture is EXACTLY the same.

Professor Sharp is a very intelligent lecturer. However, I do not recommend his classes for anyone that is not planning to major in history. The class required a lot of memorization that was perhaps a little difficult for a lower division class. *NOTE-if you come across Heather Paul as a TA, switch sections. Really unfair in her grading.

ModEuroHist was a good class. Expect to read and memorize dates and names.  His reading schedule was rigorous for a lower division course. Expect to read more than a textbook such as novels and a economic book. His lectures were quite enjoyable, but tests are from the readings mostely. He gives test essay prompts early. Read and study what he says.
He is an entertaining professor and is enthusiastic about what he is teaching. So far he is my favorite professor and I highly recommend taking his class!!

By far my favorite professor at UCSC. He's certainly not there to entertain you, but if you're at all interested in history you should take one of his classes, esp Dutch/Brit series. A subtly humorous speaker, I actually looked forward to his lectures. Not a crowdpleaser like BT but a great teacher.

I came to this university as a freshmen thinking that History classes were not going to be boring anymore...I was wrong. He was the most boring professor I have had thus far, and I have been here for a year. If like world history, this class will make you hate it.

Sharp is an interesting and engaging professor if you love history.  I took 5-7 pgs of notes each day.  He'll surprise you with his humor at random moments.  I learned a LOT and decided to major in history after taking this class.
